channel.title: When i try to run my Wind7 "run.bat" Weird ERROR! PLEASE HELP!
channel.description:
Hi, for some reason, when i try to run my server 64 - bit it says this:
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.ClassFormatError: Incompatible magic value 0 in class file Animable at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass1(Native Method) at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClassCond(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source) at java.security.SecureClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source) at java.net.URLClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source) at java.net.URLClassLoader.access$000(Unknown Source) at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(Unknown Source) at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) Could not find the main class: Gui. Program will exit. Press any key to continue . . .
Any Help?

item.title: When i try to run my Wind7 "run.bat" Weird ERROR! PLEASE HELP!
item.dc:creator: @Vince2 Vince,
item.description:
@Vince2 wrote:

[quote=“TOMSCAPE BETA, post:2, topic:375011”]Never seen that one before, I here it’s something to do with having 2 versions of JDK installed. I did a quick search on Google to find this. Though I hear making .bats into .exes on W7 fixes most things.

I’ve never used W7 so, not too sure.[/quote]

I use a batch file with W7, .exe gives errors, and it has nothing to do with W7, the top states there’s an incompatible value, the Gui error states it cannot find Gui.class.

Read full topic
item.source: When i try to run my Wind7 "run.bat" Weird ERROR! PLEASE HELP!

item.title: When i try to run my Wind7 "run.bat" Weird ERROR! PLEASE HELP!
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

Never seen that one before, I here it’s something to do with having 2 versions of JDK installed. I did a quick search on Google to find this. Though I hear making .bats into .exes on W7 fixes most things.

I’ve never used W7 so, not too sure.
